com.tinkerpop.blueprints.impls.dex

Class DexGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tinkerpop.blueprints.impls.dex.DexGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph, KeyIndexableGraph, MetaGraph<com.sparsity.dex.gdb.Graph>, TransactionalGraph

    public class DexGraph
extends Object
implements MetaGraph<com.sparsity.dex.gdb.Graph>, KeyIndexableGraph, TransactionalGraph
    Dex is a graph database developed by Sparsity Technologies.

    Dex natively supports the property graph data model defined by Blueprints. However, there are a few peculiarities. No user defined element identifiers: Dex is the gatekeeper and creator of vertex and edge identifiers. Thus, when creating a new vertex or edge instance, the provided object identifier is ignored.

    Vertices are labeled too: When adding vertices, the user can set label to be used as the label of the vertex to be created. Also, the label of a vertex (or even an element) can be retrieved through the StringFactory.LABEL property.

    DexGraph implements KeyIndexableGraph with some particularities on the way it can be used. As both vertices and edges are labeled when working with Dex, the use of some APIs may require previously setting the label (by means of label). Those APIs are: getVertices(String, Object), getEdges(String, Object), and #createKeyIndex(String, Class).

    When working with DexGraph, all methods having as a result a collection actually return a CloseableIterable collection. Thus users can CloseableIterable.close() the collection to free resources. Otherwise, all those collections will automatically be closed when the transaction is stopped (stopTransaction(com.tinkerpop.blueprints.TransactionalGraph.Conclusion) or if the database is stopped ( shutdown()).

    Author:
    Sparsity Technologies

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_DEX_VERTEX_LABEL

        public static final String DEFAULT_DEX_VERTEX_LABEL
        Default Vertex label.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • label

        public ThreadLocal<String> label
        This is a "bypass" to set the Dex vertex label (node type).

        Dex vertices belong to a vertex/node type (thus all of them have a label). By default, all vertices will have the DEFAULT_DEX_VERTEX_LABEL label. The user may set a different vertex label by setting this property when calling addVertex(Object).

        Moreover, this value will also be used for the KeyIndex-related methods.

        See Also:
        addVertex(Object), #createKeyIndex(String, Class), getVertices(String, Object), getEdges(String, Object)

      • getVertices

      • getVertices

        public CloseableIterable<Vertex> getVertices(String key,
                                    Object value)
        Returns an iterable to all the vertices in the graph that have a particular key/value property.

        In case key is StringFactory.LABEL, it returns an iterable of all the vertices having the given value as the label (therefore, belonging to the given type).

        In case label is null, it will return all vertices having a particular key/value no matters the type. In case label is not null, it will return all vertices having a particular key/value belonging to the given type.

        Specified by:
        getVertices in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        key - the key of vertex
        value - the value of the vertex
        Returns:
        an iterable of vertices with provided key and value
        See Also:
        Graph.getVertices(String, Object), label

      • getEdges

        public CloseableIterable<Edge> getEdges(String key,
                               Object value)
        Returns an iterable to all the edges in the graph that have a particular key/value property.

        In case key is StringFactory.LABEL, it returns an iterable of all the edges having the given value as the label (therefore, belonging to the given type).

        In case label is null, it will return all edges having a particular key/value no matters the type. In case label is not null, it will return all edges having a particular key/value belonging to the given type.

        Specified by:
        getEdges in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the edge
        value - the value of the edge
        Returns:
        an iterable of edges with provided key and value
        See Also:
        Graph.getEdges(String, Object), label

      • getFeatures

        Get the particular features of the graph implementation. Not all graph implementations are identical nor perfectly implement the Blueprints API. The Features object returned contains meta-data about numerous potential divergences between implementations.

      • createKeyIndex

        public <T extends Element> void createKeyIndex(String key,
                                      Class<T> elementClass,
                                      Parameter... indexParameters)
        Create an automatic indexing structure for indexing provided key for element class.

        Dex attributes are restricted to an specific vertex/edge type. The property label must be used to specify the vertex/edge label.

        The index could be created even before the vertex/edge label had been created (that is, there are no instances for the given vertex/edge label). If so, this will create the vertex/edge type automatically. The same way, if necessary the attribute will be created automatically.

        FIXME: In case the attribute is created, this always creates an String attribute, could this be set somehow?

        Specified by:
        createKeyIndex in interface KeyIndexableGraph
        Type Parameters:
        T - the element class specification
        Parameters:
        key - the key to create the index for
        elementClass - the element class that the index is for
        indexParameters - a collection of parameters for the underlying index implementation

      • stopTransaction

        public void stopTransaction(TransactionalGraph.Conclusion conclusion)
        Description copied from interface: TransactionalGraph
        Stop the current transaction. Specify whether the transaction was successful or not. A failing transaction will rollback all updates to before the transaction was started.

        If there is currently no open transaction (i.e. no operations on the graph), then calling this method has no effect other than potentially re-initializing data structures.

        Specified by:
        stopTransaction in interface TransactionalGraph
        Parameters:
        conclusion - whether or not the current transaction was successful

        Specified by:
        query in interface Graph
        Returns:
        a graph query object with methods for constraining which data is pulled from the underlying graph
